title: Business & Finance
text:
The Nasdaq entered correction territory, ending the session down 1.1%. The S&P 500 and Dow industrials both dropped 1%.

---

AIG and Chubb are ending coverage for some pricey homes in California, as insurers worry about wildfire exposure and are frustrated by state regulations.

---

A booming market for deals and brisk demand for financial advice lifted Morgan Stanley 's fourth-quarter earnings and helped the firm set a full-year profit record.

---

Bank of America 's quarterly profit rose 28%, boosted by record investment-banking revenue and recovering appetite for borrowing.

---

Disney is shaking up its streaming management and forming a new hub for international content creation.

---

P&G said sales increased 6% in its latest quarter, fueled in part by the company's largest average price increases since the spring of 2019.

---

Unilever said it wouldn't increase its $68 billion offer for Glaxo's consumer-healthcare business, effectively walking away from the potential acquisition.

---

The launch of enhanced 5G services had a limited impact on U.S. flights after aviation regulators provided additional guidance for airlines.
